summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence primarily between attorney Joe Nascimento and an Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York, discussing the scheduling of meetings and calls related to a client (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) in the Epstein investigation. The emails span from July 2019 to September 2021 and detail plans for proffer sessions and coordination around travel and weather events.

persons.name: Joe Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney from Ross Amsel Raben Nascimento, PLLC, communicating with federal prosecutors to schedule meetings and calls regarding a client involved in the Epstein investigation. He references being the inventory attorney for a deceased partner's former client.

persons.name: Allison
persons.context: A prosecutor from the Southern District of New York (referred to as 'AUSA' in one signature block) corresponding with Joe Nascimento to schedule meetings and calls regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Alan Ross
persons.context: Deceased former law partner of Joe Nascimento who previously represented Ghislaine Maxwell. Nascimento references taking over as inventory attorney for Ross's former client.

connections.description: Attorney and federal prosecutor coordinating meetings and calls regarding a client in the Epstein investigation, indicating a professional legal relationship.
Former law partners; Nascimento took over as inventory attorney for Ross's former client (Ghislaine Maxwell) after Ross's death.

events.title: Initial Meeting in West Palm Beach
events.description: A meeting scheduled between Joe Nascimento and federal prosecutors at the Hilton in West Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Session
events.description: A proffer session was scheduled for Ghislaine Maxwell (referred to as 'S' in the emails) with federal prosecutors, to be held at a hotel in West Palm Beach.

events.title: Hurricane Disruption
events.description: A storm (likely Hurricane Dorian) impacted scheduling, with Nascimento checking on travel plans and noting they had to 'hunker down for 2 days'.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Served
events.description: An FBI agent was served with a grand jury subpoena related to the Epstein case, prompting contact with Joe Nascimento.

locations: Hilton in West Palm Beach, 600 Okeechobee Blvd, West Palm Beach, FL
keyFacts: Attorney Joe Nascimento was coordinating proffer sessions and meetings with SDNY prosecutors regarding a client (strongly implied to be Ghislaine Maxwell, referenced as 'S') in 2019.
Nascimento references being contacted as the inventory attorney for his deceased former partner Alan Ross's client, confirming Ross previously represented Ghislaine Maxwell.
The emails show active plea negotiation or cooperation discussions ('proffer') were underway between Maxwell's defense and prosecutors in the summer of 2019.
Scheduling was impacted by a major storm (likely Hurricane Dorian) in late August/early September 2019.
The correspondence chain extends into September 2021, showing a long-term professional relationship between the defense and prosecution teams.
